verses.roman:
śrī-bādarāyaṇir uvāca
athaikadātmajau prāptau
kṛta-pādābhivandanau
vasudevo 'bhinandyāha
prītyā saṅkarṣaṇācyutau

synonyms: śrī-bādarāyaṇiḥ uvāca—Śrī Bādarāyaṇi (Śukadeva Gosvāmī) said; atha—then; ekadā—one day; ātmajau—his two sons; prāptau—came to him; kṛta—having done; pāda—of his feet; abhivandanau—honoring; vasudevaḥ—Vasudeva; abhinandya—greeting Them; āha—said; prītyā—affectionately; saṅkarṣaṇa-acyutau—to Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa.
translation: Śrī Bādarāyaṇi said: One day the two sons of Vasudeva—Saṅkarṣaṇa and Acyuta—came to pay him respects, bowing down at his feet. Vasudeva greeted Them with great affection and spoke to Them.
